meanings.definition: To have a strong desire or craving for something.
meanings.sent1: She was hanking for a piece of chocolate all day.
meanings.sent2: He always starts hanking for pizza as soon as he smells it.
meanings.sent3: After seeing the delicious cake, she couldn't stop hanking for a slice.
meanings.sent4: His hanking for adventure led him to explore unknown lands.
meanings.sent5: The hanking for knowledge burned within her like a bright flame.

meanings.definition: A coil or loop of rope or yarn.
meanings.sent1: The sailor neatly coiled the hanking of rope on the deck.
meanings.sent2: She used a hanking of yarn to knit a cozy scarf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the hanking of yarn, unraveling it all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The hanking of rope lay neatly on the dock, ready for use.
meanings.sent5: The hanking of yarn resembled a colorful snake in the basket.

meanings.definition: To pull or draw with force.
meanings.sent1: He hanked the stubborn door open with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She hanked the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to hank the toy out of his sister's hand.
meanings.sent4: The storm winds hanked at the sails of the ship.
meanings.sent5: The tractor hanked the tree stump out of the ground effortlessly.
